column70: Stone fruit host information is conflicting.  Prunus spp. are reported as a main host (CABI, 2015).  However, peach and cherry are reported as minor hosts (CABI, 2015) and stone fruit are mentioned as minor hosts in EPPO (nd).

column1: Fusarium oxysporum f.sp. cubense Tropical race 4

column70: Damage to these hosts is mainly caused by viruses which this planthopper vectors.

column2: No common name, an ambrosia beetle

column70: Often found in mixed infections, specific damage is unclear.

column1: Tobamovirus Cucumber green mottle mosaic virus

column70: This beetle also can live in many dead wood hosts. Only known major living hosts are included here.

column1: Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzae, X. oryzae pv. oryzicola
▲ = Primary host (economic damage has been reported in the scientific literature)
* = Included as a commodity and a tree/shrub
